div.p: I tak the opertuney of Riten you A few lines to let you no that I am well at this time and I hope when thes few lines comes to hands that thay mae find you inday the same blesen I Receve you letter from Mr limones he Rote hit to me hit did releve my mind verre much to reseve A letter from you I was begint to think that I was nevr gone to git A letter from you enmore I was sarre to her that you was out of persissonInday hit pudniChil me to hear of hit but tri and git long the best you can tel I Can send you som monney I will send hit to you as son as I can git hit

tel Mr Dennis to not let you suffer Inday I wust that I cud com home but but thay dnt love no ferlow I drem A bote you evre nite I drempe one night that we was camp clost to Randolph and I thout you and MrsUketson had com to see us I thout that I was fixen to go home with you you better beleve that I was A fixen in A herre when I wak I was fold badly.

John is well he send his lov to you. Inday I wount you to leve thar ef the yanks comes thar ef can I wount you to go with sum body that is gon to leve thar tel Mr Dennis ef he leves thar to take you with

him ef he lese but I am in hopes thay wont come thar bille Whillar Com to see us he told me that thay was A man told him that he saw Frank hear I cant git A chant to go and see him Inday I want Com home but I Cant Com now and I dont now when I can for thay wont give no furlows I want you to pick up A big resluson and say you will be content tel my times is out I waunt you to rite to wether I must Gonefor the war ar not sum time I think I will git A transfur and go to fort pillerFort Pillow thay will giv me A transfer ef I goin fer the war but I dont waunt to gone for the war now

I had droth wate A while longer thay ar looken fo A fite A bote ten miles from this plase what is cold mostray we was orde out thar bute we could not git gunes serfisen to fite with and we did not go i expect thay ar fiten thar to Day I can har the cannon wanceand while I dont no wether thay will be eney fiten hear ar not I am A frad that thay will pase fort piller I am A frede ef thay do pase thar thay will do A hepe A dammages to the pepele thar Thar is A haps of sixson in our Camps James Farras A member of our Comney was taken seck A Tusday morne and he Dide the next morne at one o clock hit is sompthing like the brane fever ever one

Indiana tel Mr Dennis that Dock ramel is A gone back whre Tome Dennis is and he Can git A chnce to send Tome eney thing he wonce to I Dont lik this plase A tole I want to git back in to tennsee A gin hit is low flat cunre here you cant gig A grave without the grav A been haf ful warter after you git dun gig hit when you pute the Coffen in the grave hit flotes in the warter Inday I wust you wud send me a guge of milk in you next letter ef you lesI wust I cud git to com home Chis little Alje for me I wuts I cud git to see his little fase wuntes more ef the yanks pas forte piller I am gone to try mitey harde to git home ef I do fale to git thar I am in hopes that sume of my frendes will take you A way ef they dont I oles thay oute to dohit

thar has bin fore Deths in our Comney sen we has bin hear the helth of our Comney is mitey bad at this time thar is a gud meny sick now thar ant mo then telve men abl for Dutey tel Chrle to stay at home tel he git sound and well so mo at preset giv my repecke to all my connexson and frendes So noth mo at present but remane you efection husban So far you well my Dears Wife Joseph. O. Freeman Rite to me as son as you gite this Inday I nevr has reseve but one letter from you yeat
